column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////But please allow me to put the situation you witnessed in some context
column2: as well. In the three years we have been open
column3: there have been several occasions when (presumably) homeless individuals have entered our restaurant and ordered food
column4: both to dine in and also to-go. These individuals paid for their meals in full and left the premises sans problems. On other occasions
column6: presumably) homeless individuals approach the bar or host stand and simply ask us for food -- not money. On the albeit rare occasions this has happened
column7: we have given these individuals a meal for free.
